question_text:
Question 20 
 
  
[Fluid Mechanics : Open Channel Flow]
The number of degrees of freedom for a natural open channel flow with a mobile bed is
(A) 2 
(B) 3
(C) 4 
(D) 5  
 
Ans. (C) 
Sol. 
•  
If a channel boundary is composed of sedimentary particles moving under the action of flowing 
water, the channel is called mobile boundary channel. Example – an alluvial channel is a mobile 
boundary channel transporting the same type of material comprising the channel perimeter. 
•
 
In mobile channels, depth of flow, bed width, bed slopes and layout changes with space and time. 
•
 
Hence, mobile boundary channels have 4 degree of freedom. 
Note
 : Type of open channel 
Classification type -1 
(1)
 
Natural channel (2) Artificial channel 
Classification type -2  
(1)
 
Prismatic channel (2) Non prismatic channel

PAGE
15

Classification type -3 
(1)
 
Rigid boundary channel (2) Mobile boundary channel 
Classification type – 4 
(1)
 
Small slope channel (2) Large slope channel 
 
 
   Hence, the correct option is (C).
